result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody L Griffin in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Cody L Griffin.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Cody L Griffin in court with Attorney Michael V Fuentes. Both appear by video.
Case set for status following 22CF2381. Matter is adjourned to the trial court.  Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Cody L Griffin in court in person. 
Case set for status following 22CF2381. Matter is adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Contact Order with Co-Actor: Frederick Euell.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Cody L Griffin in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Cody L Griffin in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cody L Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to the Co-Actor's lower pending matters, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
